code: @Manual{,   title = {ppendemic: The red book of endemic plants of Peru data},   author = {Paul Efren Santos Andrade and Lucely L. Vilca Bustamante},   year = {2021},   note = {R package version 0.1.4},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.5106619},   url = {https://github.com/PaulESantos/ppendemic}, }

title: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants
text: ppendemic R package provides easy access new database containing list endemic plant species found Peru. package includes collection 7,249 species detailed botanical information, accepted names, family, authorship, publication details, place date first publication.

title: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants
text: can install ppendemic package GitHub using following command:

title: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants
text: ppendemic database consists 7,249 rows 7 columns, row representing unique endemic plant species. columns database include: accepted_name: accepted scientific name endemic plant species. accepted_family: family plant species belongs. accepted_name_author: author accepted scientific name. publication_author: author publication species described. place_of_publication: place publication species. volume_and_page: volume page number publication. first_published: year first publication. database covers total 169 families, particularly rich Orchidaceae, Asteraceae, Piperaceae, Solanaceae, Fabaceae, Bromeliaceae, Melastomataceae, Araceae, Rubiaceae, Gentianaceae families, highest number endemic species Peru.

what: Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
title: Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
text: function takes list species names, searches data ppendemic_tab dataset, returns data frame containing relevant information species.

title: Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
text: splist character vector containing names species search . max_distance maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names. Defaults 0.1.

title: Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
text: data frame containing retrieved information species.

title: Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
code: get_ppendemic_data(splist = c("Aa aurantiaca", "Aa aurantiaaia", "werneria nubigena")) #>      name_submitted accepted_name accepted_family accepted_name_author #> 1     Aa aurantiaca Aa aurantiaca     Orchidaceae           D.Trujillo #> 2    Aa aurantiaaia Aa aurantiaca     Orchidaceae           D.Trujillo #> 3 Werneria nubigena          nill            nill                 nill #>   publication_author place_of_publication volume_and_page first_published dist #> 1               <NA>        Lankesteriana           11: 3          (2011)    0 #> 2               <NA>        Lankesteriana           11: 3          (2011)    2 #> 3               nill                 nill            nill            nill nill

what: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
text: function checks list species names endemic ppendemic database. Endemic species native restricted specific geographic area, case, Peru. function allows fuzzy matching species names maximum distance threshold handle potential typos variations species names.

title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
text: splist character vector containing list species names checked endemism ppendemic database. max_distance numeric value (default 0.1) specifying maximum distance fuzzy matching. non-negative value.

title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
text: character vector indicating species endemic, endemic, endemic species found using fuzzy matching.

title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
code: is_ppendemic(c("Aa aurantiaca", "Aa aurantiaaia", "Werneria nubigena")) #> [1] "Aa aurantiaca is endemic"                  #> [2] "Aa aurantiaca is endemic - fuzzy matching" #> [3] "not endemic"

what: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
title: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
text: ppendemic_tab dataset tibble (data frame) provides easy access comprehensive database Peru's endemic plant species. contains total 7,249 records essential botanical information, including accepted name, accepted family, accepted name author, publication author, place publication, volume page, first published details.

title: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
text: tibble (data frame) 7249 rows 7 columns: accepted_name Character vector. accepted name endemic plant species. accepted_family Character vector. family accepted name endemic plant species. accepted_name_author Character vector. author(s) accepted name endemic plant species. publication_author Character vector. author(s) publication containing endemic plant species information. place_of_publication Character vector. place publication endemic plant species information. volume_and_page Character vector. volume page number publication containing endemic plant species information. first_published Character vector. first published year publication containing endemic plant species information.

title: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
text: dataset carefully compiled updated offer latest insights Peru's endemic plant species. Original sources data include authoritative botanical publications research articles available WCVP database.

title: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
text: dataset provides curated --date collection Peru's endemic plant species, gathered reputable botanical sources publications. data database extracted compiled World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP) database, comprehensive reliable repository botanical information. Researchers, botanists, ecologists, nature enthusiasts can use dataset explore study unique diverse flora exclusive Peru. dataset particularly valuable conducting studies related biodiversity, conservation, ecological research.

title: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
code: if (FALSE) { # Load the package library(ppendemic)  # Access the dataset ppendemic_tab }
